text: Psalm 97
Yahweh’s Glorious Reign
Yahweh is king! Let the earth rejoice;
let many coastlands be glad.
Cloud and thick darkness \add are\add* surrounding him;
righteousness and justice \add are\add* the foundation of his throne.
Fire goes before him,
and devours his enemies round about.
His lightnings light \add the\add* world;
the earth sees and trembles.
\add The\add* mountains melt like wax at the presence of Yahweh,
at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.
The heavens declare his righteousness,
and all the peoples see his glory.
Let all who serve an image be ashamed,
those who boast about idols.\f + \fr 97:7 \ft This word for idols suggests something worthless or insignificant \f*
Worship him, all you gods.
Zion hears and is glad,
and the daughters of Judah rejoice
because of your judgments, O Yahweh.
For you, O Yahweh, \add are\add* most high over all the earth.
You are highly\f + \fr 97:9 \ft Hebrew “very” \f* exalted above all gods.
You who love Yahweh, hate evil.
He protects the lives of his faithful;
he delivers them from \add the\add* hand of \add the\add* wicked.
Light \add is\add* sown for the righteous,
and joy for \add the\add* upright in heart.
Be glad in Yahweh, \add you\add* righteous,
and give thanks ⸤to his holy name⸥.\f + \fr 97:12 \ft Literally “to his holy remembrance” or “to his memorable holiness” \f*
